mni-Mtei: ꯊꯨꯅꯥ ꯌꯥꯡꯅꯥ ꯂꯥꯏꯔꯤꯛ ꯍꯩꯕꯥ ꯏꯂꯤꯠ ꯒ꯭ꯔꯨꯞ ꯑꯃꯁꯨꯡ ꯅꯍꯥ ꯀꯌꯥꯅꯥ ꯃꯦꯏꯇꯦꯏ ꯁ꯭ꯛꯔꯤꯞꯇꯀꯤ ꯔꯤꯚꯥꯏꯚꯦꯂꯤꯖꯝ ꯑꯃꯁꯨꯡ ꯗꯤꯕꯦꯂꯄꯃꯦꯟꯇꯀꯤ ꯈꯣꯡꯖꯪꯗꯥ ꯁꯔꯨꯛ ꯌꯥꯈꯤ

en: In the year 1934 during the reign of Meitei King Churachand Singh Meitei ꯅꯡꯊ ꯆꯔꯆꯟꯗ ꯁꯡꯍ the then Maharajah of Manipur kingdom a group named Beebodh Janani Shabha published a book titled Meetei Yelhou Lairik  Meitei ꯃꯇ ꯌꯜꯍ ꯂꯏꯔꯛ and urged the then Royal Court to implement the Meitei script
mni-Mtei: ꯆꯍꯤ ꯱꯹꯳꯴ ꯗꯥ ꯃꯦꯏꯇꯦꯏ ꯅꯤꯡꯊꯧ ꯆꯨꯔꯥꯆꯟ ꯁꯤꯡꯍ ꯃꯦꯏꯇꯦꯏ ꯏꯪ 1934 ꯗꯥ ꯃꯅꯤꯄꯨꯔꯒꯤ ꯅꯤꯡꯊꯧ ꯂꯩꯕꯥꯛꯀꯤ ꯃꯇꯃꯗꯨꯒꯤ ꯃꯍꯥꯔꯥꯖꯥ ꯁꯤꯡꯅꯆꯤꯡꯕꯥ ꯃꯤꯇꯩ ꯃꯆꯥꯁꯤꯡꯅꯥ ꯃꯤꯇꯩꯔꯣꯅꯗꯥ ꯉꯥꯉꯕꯥ ꯌꯥꯕꯥ ꯂꯥꯏꯔꯤꯛ ꯑꯃꯥ ꯐꯣꯉꯕꯥ ꯂꯥꯏꯔꯤꯛ ꯑꯃꯥ ꯐꯣꯡꯈꯤ

en: Subsequently in the year 1946 another group named Meetei Mayek Thougal Marup Meitei ꯃꯇ ꯃꯌꯛ ꯊꯒꯜ ꯃꯔꯞ published a book titled Meetei Mayek Ahanba Meitei ꯃꯇ ꯃꯌꯛ ꯑꯍꯟꯕ and urged the then Manipur State Council to accept it
mni-Mtei: ꯃꯇꯨꯡ ꯇꯥꯔꯀꯄꯗꯥ ꯆꯍꯤ ꯱꯹꯴꯶ꯇꯥ ꯑꯇꯣꯞꯄꯥ ꯀꯥꯡꯂꯨꯞ ꯑꯃꯅꯥ ꯃꯤꯇꯦꯌ ꯃꯥꯌꯦꯛ ꯊꯣꯎꯒꯥꯜ ꯃꯧꯔꯨꯞ ꯃꯦꯏꯇꯦꯏ ꯑꯦꯁꯄꯤꯔꯤꯑꯣꯁꯋꯥꯔꯤꯅꯥ ꯏꯁꯩ ꯅꯣꯡꯃꯥꯏꯒꯤ ꯃꯤꯑꯣꯏ ꯑꯃꯥ ꯑꯣꯏꯅꯥ ꯐꯣꯉꯕꯥ ꯂꯥꯏꯔꯤꯛ ꯑꯃꯥ ꯐꯣꯡꯈꯤ ꯑꯃꯁꯨꯡ ꯃꯇꯝ ꯑꯗꯨꯒꯤ ꯃꯅꯤꯄꯨꯔ ꯁ꯭ꯇꯦꯠ ꯀꯥꯎꯟꯁꯤꯂꯅꯥ ꯃꯁꯤꯕꯨ ꯌꯥꯅꯕꯥ ꯍꯥꯌꯔꯀꯈꯤ

en: Afterwards on 13 March 1958 many Meitei script scholars and enthusiasts organised a grand meeting at the office of Manipur Motor Association thereby creating the Meetei Mayek Luptin Committee Meitei ꯃꯇ ꯃꯌꯛ ꯂꯞꯇꯟ ꯀꯝꯃꯇ which spearheaded the Meitei script movement massively in the later years
mni-Mtei: ꯃꯗꯨꯒꯤ ꯃꯇꯨꯡꯗꯥ ꯃꯥꯔꯆ ꯱꯳, ꯱꯹꯵꯸ꯗꯥ ꯃꯦꯏꯇꯦ ꯁ꯭ꯛꯔꯤꯞꯇ ꯁ꯭ꯀꯣꯂꯥꯔ ꯑꯃꯁꯨꯡ ꯏꯊꯨꯁꯤꯌꯥꯁ ꯀꯌꯥꯅꯥ ꯃꯅꯤꯄꯨꯔ ꯃꯣꯇꯣꯔ ꯑꯦꯁꯣꯁꯤꯑꯦꯁꯅꯒꯤ ꯑꯣꯐꯤꯁꯇꯥ ꯑꯆꯧꯕꯥ ꯃꯤꯐꯝ ꯑꯃꯥ ꯄꯥꯉꯊꯣꯀꯈꯤ ꯃꯗꯨꯅꯥ ꯃꯤꯇꯦꯌ ꯃꯥꯌꯦꯛ ꯂꯨꯄꯇꯤꯟ ꯀꯃꯤꯇꯤ ꯃꯦꯏꯇꯦꯏ ꯁꯤꯡ SPEATURS ꯁꯦꯃꯈꯤ ꯑꯃꯁꯨꯡ ꯃꯗꯨꯒꯤ ꯃꯇꯨꯡꯗꯥ ꯃꯦꯏꯇꯦꯏ ꯁ꯭ꯛꯔꯤꯞꯇ ꯃꯨꯚꯃꯦꯟꯇꯅꯥ ꯃꯇꯨꯡ ꯇꯥꯔꯀꯄꯥ ꯆꯍꯤꯁꯤꯡꯗꯥ ꯌꯥꯝꯅꯥ ꯊꯨꯅꯥ ꯌꯥꯡꯅꯥ ꯆꯦꯜꯂꯀꯈꯤ

en: In a period between March 1958 to February 1959 multiple symposia were organised and in a certain meeting the Meetei Mayek subcommittee passed a resolution to accept the use of 27 letter system of the Meitei script including 18 ancient alphabets that read the letters as Kok Sam Lai Mit Pa
mni-Mtei: ꯃꯥꯔꯆ ꯱꯹꯵꯸ꯗꯒꯤ ꯐꯦꯕ꯭ꯔꯨꯋꯥꯔꯤ ꯱꯹꯵꯹ ꯐꯥꯑꯣꯕꯒꯤ ꯃꯔꯛꯇꯥ ꯂꯩꯕꯥ ꯃꯇꯝ ꯑꯃꯗꯥ ꯃꯜꯇꯤꯄꯜ ꯁꯤꯝꯄꯣꯁꯤꯌꯥ ꯑꯣꯔꯒꯅꯥꯏꯖ ꯇꯧꯈꯤ ꯑꯃꯁꯨꯡ ꯑꯀꯛꯅꯕꯥ ꯃꯤꯐꯝ ꯑꯃꯗꯥ ꯃꯤꯇꯦ ꯃꯥꯌꯦꯛ ꯁꯕꯀꯃꯤꯇꯤꯅꯥ ꯃꯦꯏꯇꯦ ꯁ꯭ꯛꯔꯤꯞꯇꯀꯤ ꯲꯷ ꯂꯦꯇꯔ ꯁꯤꯁ꯭ꯇꯦꯝ ꯁꯤꯖꯤꯟꯅꯕꯥ ꯌꯥꯅꯕꯥ ꯔꯤꯖꯣꯂꯨꯁꯟ ꯑꯃꯥ ꯄꯥꯁ ꯇꯧꯈꯤ ꯃꯗꯨꯗꯥ ꯂꯦꯇꯔꯁꯤꯡ ꯑꯗꯨ ꯀꯣꯛ ꯁꯦꯝ ꯂꯥꯏ ꯃꯤꯠ ꯄꯥ

en: A decade after the birth of Mayek Luptin Committee Meitei ꯃꯌꯛ ꯂꯞꯇꯟ ꯀꯝꯃꯇ an organisation named Lol Amasung Mayek Neinaba Apun Lup Meitei ꯂꯜ ꯑꯃꯁꯡ ꯃꯌꯛ ꯅꯅꯕ ꯑꯄꯟ ꯂꯞ organised a symposium about Meitei script during February 1969 and another symposium on 9 November 1969

en: Afterwards most of the experts had the consensus on the 27 letter system

en: The symposium organised by the Progressive Writers Association from 11 to 12 September 1976 at GM Hall followed by multiple academic meetings for more than two months accepted the 27 letter system
mni-Mtei: ꯄ꯭ꯔꯣꯒ꯭ꯔꯦꯁꯤꯚ ꯔꯥꯏꯇꯔꯁ ꯑꯦꯁꯣꯁꯤꯑꯦꯁꯟꯅꯥ ꯱꯹꯷꯶ꯀꯤ ꯁꯦꯞꯇꯦꯝꯕꯔ ꯱꯱ꯗꯒꯤ ꯱꯲ ꯐꯥꯑꯣꯕꯥ ꯖꯤ.ꯑꯦꯝ.ꯍꯣꯂꯗꯥ ꯄꯥꯡꯊꯣꯀꯈꯤꯕꯥ ꯁꯤꯝꯄꯣꯖꯤꯌꯝ ꯑꯗꯨꯅꯥ ꯊꯥ ꯑꯅꯤ ꯍꯦꯟꯅꯥ ꯃꯁꯤꯡ ꯌꯥꯝꯂꯕꯥ ꯑꯦꯀꯥꯗꯦꯃꯤꯛ ꯃꯤꯐꯃꯁꯤꯡ ꯄꯥꯡꯊꯣꯛꯇꯨꯅꯥ ꯲꯷ ꯂꯦꯇꯔ ꯁꯤꯁ꯭ꯇꯦꯝ ꯑꯁꯤ ꯌꯥꯈꯤ꯫

en: The 27 letter system was also accepted by the meeting held on 13 November 1976 the state level meeting held at TG Higher Secondary School during May 1978 the meeting of the Meetei Mayek Expert Committee  Meitei ꯃꯇ ꯃꯌꯛ ꯑꯈ ꯑꯍ ꯂꯞ on 16 November 1978 and many others

en: On 16 November 1978 the Kangleipak Eyek Kanba Phamthon Lup  Meitei ꯀꯂꯄꯛ ꯏꯌꯛ ꯀꯟꯕ ꯐꯝꯊꯟ ꯂꯞ and the All Manipur Students Union jointly formed the Meitei Mayek Expert Committee MMEC

en: With the reorganisation of Manipur Central the subdivision got attached to the Imphal East district

en: A movement for a separate revenue district for Jiribam took shape in 2006 and a Jiribam District Demand Committee JDDC was formed

en: During 2011 the committee conducted several strikes and economic blockades along NH37 which passes through Jiribam

en: The government also agreed to upgrade the Borobekra Circle in the southern part of the region into a subdivision

en: In 2016 Jiribam subdivision became an independent Jiribam district

en: According to multiple sources the proscribed Meitei insurgent groups United National Liberation Front UNLF and Peoples Liberation Army of Manipur PLA used the Jiribam valley and the neighbouring Cachar district of Assam as their main area of operations

en: The region was originally used by Meitei insurgent groups in the 1960s as a launching pad to access the training camps run by InterServices Intelligence ISI in East Pakistan presentday Bangladesh
